1: To the Lord I cry out;[d] to the Lord I plead for mercy.[e]
2: I pour out my lament before him; I tell him about[f] my troubles.
3: Even when my strength leaves me,[g] you watch my footsteps.[h] In the path where I walk they have hidden a trap for me.
4: Look to the right and see. No one cares about me.[i] I have nowhere to run;[j] no one is concerned about my life.[k]
5: I cry out to you, O Lord; I say, “You are my shelter, my security[l] in the land of the living.”
6: Listen to my cry for help, for I am in serious trouble.[m] Rescue me from those who chase me, for they are stronger than I am.
7: Free me[n] from prison, that I may give thanks to your name. Because of me the godly will assemble,[o] for you will vindicate me.[p]
